org.jdesktop.core.animation.timing
Interface Interpolator

All Known Implementing Classes:
AccelerateDecelerateInterpolator, AccelerateInterpolator, AccelerationInterpolator, AnticipateInterpolator, AnticipateOvershootInterpolator, BounceInterpolator, DecelerateInterpolator, DiscreteInterpolator, LinearInterpolator, LinearInterpolator, OvershootInterpolator, SplineInterpolator
@Immutable
public interface Interpolator

This interface provides a mechanism for animating object properties between different values. It defines the single interpolate(double) method.

This interface is implemented by built-in interpolators. Applications may choose to implement their own interpolator to get custom interpolation behavior.

Author:
Chet Haase
See Also:
AccelerationInterpolator, DiscreteInterpolator, LinearInterpolator, SplineInterpolator

Method Summary
 double interpolate(double fraction)
          This function takes an input value between 0 and 1 and returns another value, also between 0 and 1.
 

Method Detail

interpolate

@RegionEffects(value="reads All")
double interpolate(double fraction)
This function takes an input value between 0 and 1 and returns another value, also between 0 and 1. The purpose of the function is to define how time (represented as a (0-1) fraction of the duration of an animation) is altered to derive different value calculations during an animation.

Parameters:
fraction - a value between 0 and 1, inclusive, representing the elapsed fraction of a time interval.
Returns:
a value between 0 and 1, inclusive. Values outside of this boundary may be clamped to the interval [0,1] and cause undefined results.
